text: More than just a place to worship on Sunday's. They have an outreach ministry that offers free food and breakfast every other week, and a yard sale where you can find some outstanding bargains.

name: Susan P Brown
text: My Sunday place to be.  All are welcome at St. Mary's.  Please join me at 9:15 for worship, followed by fellowship.  Second Sundays we have a potluck luncheon.

name: Emily Amberson
text: We came to visit this church not long after my husband and I married in 2007 and we never left! We have been so blessed to find this church and the folks who make this place so special.

name: Camille Bowman
text: I knew I had found my church home when Father Michael handed me a bumper sticker with "LIVE IT" and "Live the Resurrection Life" as the theme and logo of the church.  I've never looked elsewhere. LIVE IT!

name: David Ryan
text: As a 17 year member, I'm biased. A loving and welcoming congregation. A beautiful setting, both in the church and the parish hall or memory garden. Very active in outreach in the community and very active in the Diocese of Alabama. For visiting Episcopalians, inquiring minds, seekers of faith, a place you could find a wonderful experience.

name: Glenn Day
text: Warm people who practice what they believe...a non judgement zone.

name: Vinnie Markovski
text: Service was great, message received. Although when I got out, I found my car had been towed. Cat was not happy as we had to walk several miles to the impound. Cost us $160 plus tax and handling. Some signage would be appreciated.

name: Elizabeth Aversa
text:
Excellent parish, welcoming to all. Very friendly and social justice oriented.
Parking has to be restricted to parishioners, residents,  and church business due to the proximity to the University.

name: John Willingham
text: my daughter is a cheerleader went to perform for the school was late, all parking spots were gone she thought she would park there since other cars were there car was towed cost us 160$ she was told to park there in past with no issues.. great Christian atmosphere

text: Can't ever find anything wrong with God's people 😀

name: susan glandon
text: This is a beautiful church, with kind, welcoming clergy and members. I'm so happy to be vaccinated and back to church!

name: Dorothy Campbell
text: The lobster dinner was very good. But they need to up their game on the lobster roll.

name: Mikki M.
text: I have never found a church like this, so loving, welcoming and giving. The people are wonderful and the amount of outreach they do in the community and beyond really shines the love of Jesus to those in need. They have groups for just about everyone, including a "young professionals" group (ages range from twenties to mid-forties) that meets every couple months for fun get togethers, where childcare is provided if needed. Whether you're looking for Bible study, a support group, or just a Christian community that doesn't judge, this is a great place to check out. Come join us!

name: Angie Pradat
text: A wonderful community of welcoming, inclusive, loving people.  Lots to offer for those looking for a place to fit in.  The sermons are relevant and so inspiring. St Thomas welcomes ALL.  Come join us!

name: D Brooks
text: A unique find. This is truly the most welcoming church and faith I’ve ever experienced.  I gave up on organized religion many years before coming to St Thomas with my family for a non religious activity. I never dreamed in a few years I would be a member but I’ve never had people of a particular faith be so warm and genuine.

name: Jordy
text: Nice relaxed atmosphere. Great people, always welcoming to new comers. Serves fantastic breakfast and has a children's service. This is my all time favorite church! Completely different than any other Episcopal church.

name: Al Stokes
text: What a great church.  Enjoy the people, the worship, the challenges.  Join us.

name: Jennylmb3
text: Very nice people. We were there for an art contest and art show. No one there really knew us but they welcomed us in and made us feel right at home. The building was easy to find. It was right off the main road. The grounds were beautiful and well kept. We are not members of the church but i would to go for a church service one day.

name: Terri James
text: Been a member since 1969. All the members are like my family. Today was the Ordination of our new priest Sara Phillips. We are very blessed to have her.

name: Anessa Williams
text: Staff was very friendly and helpful!

name: Dale Link
text: Very friendly congregation with a beautiful worship space. Great breakfast is served at 8:30 a.m. each Sunday followed by Christian formation at 9 a.m. and Worship at 10 a.m. (Holy Communion once a month)

name: Robert Heyward
text:
Beautiful, but hostile towards history.  Tried to show family Jefferson Davis bench but was informed it was removed.  Very disappointing for all.

5 stars for beauty and historic value, 1 star for lack of historic appreciation = 3 star average

name: Melissa Mease
text: Absolutely beautiful. This historic church has wonderful stained glass windows and a gorgeous sanctuary.

name: timaka redmon
text: I love just going here and being able to clear my mind in the little garden they have. It's something magical. I feel a presence each and every time I visit. Thank you for whomever decided to keep it open throughout the year.

text: A very welcoming church. God is love and loves all!!

name: Charles Stone
text: great place. nice people

name: Sherie Williams
text: I attended a wedding at this church and I was mesmerized with the beauty of the gardens and the various artist styles. The sanctuary is a museum of biblical images telling a story from the floor to the high ceilings.

text: Love

name: William McLean
text: Absolutely disgusting and crooked practices. Is in bed with "Parking Enforcement Systems", a predatory towing company. The parking lot of this place is always wide open and is staked out by tow trucks who pounce the second you pull into there. They even took a disabled woman's car while she was moving into her apartment next door. If this place truly cared about keeping unwanted cars out, it would install a gate system, rather than get a kickback from the $160 extorted from innocent victims. Sure doesn't sound very Christian to me.

name: Larry Sedar
text: Great place to worship. 3 priest's that have the Lord in their hearts and their  sermons prove it

name: N M Mills
text: Quaint old church in the Five Points district of Birmingham.  Lots of character.

name: Keith Lanford
text: My favorite church

name: Bill Martin
text: Rewading,AA meetings on Tuesday and Thursday nights at 8:00 PM

name: William Doty
text: We started attending St. John's in 2008, looking for a church to call our own. Well, we found it. We were baptized in 2010 as Episcopalians, joining the church officially and have continued to grow with St. John's thru the years. To us, it's home. The church is beautiful on it's own but the parishioners and the clergy have always made it more special to us. We even got married here in 2016. St. John's means so much to us.

name: Kelli Lovelace
text: What a wonderful group of truly great people.

name: Charles Bernhard
text: My choir at Episcopal Church of the Ascension in Vestavia Hills, AL sang lessons in carols at St. John's and the next week they came to Ascension. They were wonderful hosts and we enjoyed the trip and visit. Lovely church doing major renovations. Look forward to doing it again next year.

name: Mathew Lewis
text: Beautiful

name: Heather Richards
text: warm friendly loving.

name: Marty Thomas
text: Great people

name: Jesse Sierke
text: I attended the first live Sunday service since the COVID-19 pandemic began last weekend. Families were seated at least six feet from each other, and everyone was masked appropriately. Masks were provided for those who did not bring our own. The service was held outdoors in a beautiful pavilion. The pastor delivered a sermon that was both timely and timeless, giving hope in these difficult times. The music was stunningly beautiful, delivered by a single singer, but one who left us in tears of joy.

name: Penny Cornett
text: I have such fond memories of attending St. Luke’s back in the mid-sixties when my family lived in Birmingham. I still have my little white prayer book.

name: M M G
text: Beautiful church and friendly staff, I stopped here many a times while delivering in the area to grab some coffee or iced water. Nice relaxing place with inside and outside places to sit.

name: Kenny Gannon
text: A generous loving mission oriented church.

name: Dawn Shaw
text: My daughter is a teacher there. The pre- K program is the best! They have a beautiful church as well!

name: Todd Pierce
text: Personable. Meaningful. Full of Grace. Uplifting. Friendly.

name: Mark Stith
text: Nice church. Will attend class there this morning.

name: Mimi
text: My daughter's family attends this church and preschool.  When I'm in town I find it warm, inviting and a beautiful reflection of Christ's love in action.

name: Ronnie Lynn
text: Beautiful building.

name: Jodi Ruttenberg
text: A beautiful church

name: Shannon Alfano
text: Awesome church

name: Perry Cox
text: I came here hopeful. I left without any faith in either god or humanity.

name: Charles Bernhard
text: Lovely memorial service for my sister. High Episcopal service with incense and bells. We had Kathleen Ryan to play the bagpipes going out for interment of the ashes. My sister would have been very pleased. Also, a small volunteer choir sang the Rutter Gaelic Blessing.

name: Stephen Niemeyer
text:
I'm an Episcopalian and when I moved to Birmingham the website read. "You can wear jeans to church" and I realized this is where I'm going!

Love the rector and the people, who make any church. Great sermons every Sunday.

name: Patricia Sparkman
text: I grew up going to this church. My mother's family (Hamilton) were members since the early 1900's. I was christened as a baby here and attended Sunday school.

name: Linda Linda
text: The church feeds the community. I volunteered it was a very fulfilling experience

name: J.R. Bravo
text: Family has been going here off and on for a few years. Our daughter and niece were both baptized here. Beautiful church and kind, sweet people that attend here.

name: Chris Jones
text: Love the place I trust anyone to go have fun.

name: Jamie Lamb
text: Good people. Willing to listen, willing to help.

name: Stephen Buchanan
text: I ate at the Community Kitchen there many many times, to survive, and went back yesterday to show a new guy where to eat until he can afford food himself. All I know is everybody knows you can get food and a weather break at St Andrew's. That says something about the church, too!
